net.fathomsoft.fathom.tree

Class SyntaxTree

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.fathomsoft.fathom.tree.SyntaxTree

  • public class SyntaxTree
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that deconstructs a source code file and builds a Tree out of the statements.
    Since:
    Jan 5, 2014 at 9:00:15 PM, v0.1
    Version:
    Jan 5, 2014 at 9:00:15 PM, v0.1
    Author:
    Braden Steffaniak

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SyntaxTree(java.io.File file)
      Create a SyntaxTree instance from the source code in the specified File.
      SyntaxTree(java.lang.String filename, java.lang.String source)
      Generate a SyntaxTree instance given the name of the file and the source within it.

      Search for the main method, if one exists, in the compiling program.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SyntaxTree

        public SyntaxTree(java.io.File file)
           throws java.io.IOException
        Create a SyntaxTree instance from the source code in the specified File.
        Parameters:
        file - The file containing the Foxy source code.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if there was an error finding the file or reading from it.

      • SyntaxTree

        public SyntaxTree(java.lang.String filename,
          java.lang.String source)
        Generate a SyntaxTree instance given the name of the file and the source within it.
        Parameters:
        filename - The name of the file containing the source.
        source - The source code inside the file.

    • Method Detail

      • getMainMethod

        public MethodNode getMainMethod()
        Search for the main method, if one exists, in the compiling program. The main method has the method header as the following: 
         public static void main(String args[])
 {
        ...
 }
        Returns:
        The MethodNode representation of the main method.

      • formatText

        public java.lang.String formatText(java.lang.String text)
        Format the text to follow syntactical rules.
        Parameters:
        text - The String to format.
        Returns:
        The formatted version of the String.

      • getHeaderOutput

        public java.lang.String getHeaderOutput()
        Get the header output text (destination text) from the Syntax tree.
        Returns:
        The header output text after compilation.

      • getSourceOutput

        public java.lang.String getSourceOutput()
        Get the source output text (destination text) from the Syntax tree.
        Returns:
        The source output text after compilation.

      • getRoot

        public TreeNode getRoot()
        Get the root TreeNode of the tree. The root of the Syntax tree will be a FileNode, or FileListNode instance.
        Returns:
        The root TreeNode instance.
